pr_title: [DOCS] Specifies the possible data types of classification dependent_variable

timeline.message: [DOCS] Specifies the possible data tpyes of classification dependent_variable.

timeline.bodyText: We should also add the categorical types: ip, keyword, text
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -145,7 +145,8 @@ include::{docdir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=lambda]
 include::{docdir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=dependent-variable]
 +
 --
-The data type of the field must be numeric or boolean.
+The data type of the field must be numeric (`integer`, `short`, `byte`) or

timeline.bodyText:
Please extend this list.
Dependent variable of classification analysis must be one of:

text, keyword or ip
byte, short, integer or long
boolean
timeline.author: przemekwitek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -145,7 +145,8 @@ include::{docdir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=lambda]
 include::{docdir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=dependent-variable]
 +
 --
-The data type of the field must be numeric or boolean.
+The data type of the field must be numeric (`integer`, `short`, `byte`) or

timeline.message: [DOCS] Extends the supported data types list.

timeline.bodyText: Not sure this is a good place but it should be mentioned somewhere in the docs that the numbers should represent categories (so should be logically categorical e.g: 0 - cat, 1 - dog, 2 - horse) rather than arbitrary numbers
timeline.author: przemekwitek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -145,7 +145,8 @@ include::{docdir}/ml/ml-shared.asciidoc[tag=lambda]

 +
 --
-The data type of the field must be numeric or boolean.
+The data type of the field must be numeric (`integer`, `short`, `long`, `byte`),

replies.bodyText: I made a note and put the info to the right place.
replies.author: szabosteve
